stem: The nurse is caring for a patient in thyroid storm. Based on the provided information, which of the following interventions are MOST appropriate? Select all that apply.

itemContext.sbar: S: Eliza Montgomery, 48-year-old female, admitted at 03:00 with suspected thyroid storm. Significant history of Graves' disease, complicated by medication non-compliance. R: Patient is restless, increasingly anxious, and diaphoretic. Vital signs: HR 168, BP 180/100, Temp 104.2°F (40.1°C), RR 28 with shallow breaths. Oxygen saturation 92% on room air. Labs show TSH <0.01 mIU/L, Free T4 6.2 ng/dL, Free T3 28 pg/mL. A: Physician notified at 03:15, verbal orders received: IV fluids, cooling blanket, propranolol 1mg IV push q5 min until HR < 120, then q4h; propylthiouracil (PTU) 200mg PO q6h; continuous EKG monitoring; assess level of consciousness hourly; airborne precautions initiated. B: Patient is increasingly agitated; respiratory status is concerning. Continue close monitoring of vital signs and administer medications as ordered. Prepare for potential intubation if respiratory status declines. Consider transfer to higher level of care if no improvement.

rationale.correct: Administering propylthiouracil (PTU) inhibits thyroid hormone synthesis, addressing the underlying cause of thyroid storm. Propranolol, a beta-blocker, manages symptoms like tachycardia and hypertension. A cooling blanket reduces hyperthermia. EKG monitoring is crucial due to arrhythmia risk. IV fluids combat dehydration from hypermetabolism and fever. ClinicalPearl: Thyroid storm is a life-threatening hyperthyroidism emergency. Beta-blockers control adrenergic symptoms but don't treat the cause. PTU and methimazole are thionamides inhibiting thyroid hormone synthesis.
rationale.incorrect: Levothyroxine, a thyroid hormone replacement, worsens hyperthyroidism. Ambulation is unsafe due to unstable vital signs. Fluid restriction is contraindicated due to dehydration. Insulin is unnecessary with normal glucose. Enteral feedings are not a priority; stabilize vitals and reduce thyroid hormone levels first. QuestionTrap: Confusing hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism treatments. HowToOvercome: Differentiate between hyperthyroidism (overactive) and hypothyroidism (underactive) and their treatments. Understand each medication's purpose. Mnemonic: Thyroid Storm Management: I-C-E (IV fluids, Cooling blanket, EKG monitor) + Beta-blockers & Anti-thyroid meds (PTU/Methimazole).
clinicalPearls: Thyroid storm is a life-threatening emergency characterized by severe hyperthyroidism.
Beta-blockers are used to control the adrenergic symptoms of thyroid storm but do not address the underlying cause.
PTU and methimazole are thionamides that inhibit thyroid hormone synthesis.

questionTrap.trap: Selecting levothyroxine. Students may confuse the management of hypothyroidism with hyperthyroidism.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Carefully differentiate between hyperthyroidism (overactive thyroid) and hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid) and their respective treatments. Understand the purpose of each medication in the context of the specific endocrine disorder.

mnemonic.title: Thyroid Storm Management
mnemonic.expansion: I-C-E (IV fluids, Cooling blanket, EKG monitor) + Beta-blockers & Anti-thyroid meds (PTU/Methimazole)
